00:00:08:200000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:00:08:200000.Dialogue: That's the smell of new comic books.

00:00:18:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:18:090000.Dialogue: You're paying? Have you been selling your sperm again?

00:00:22:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:22:220000.Dialogue: No, I'm celebrating. As we speak, the space shuttle is docking at the International Space Station where it will deploy the Wolowitz Zero-Gravity Waste Disposal System.

00:00:33:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:00:33:110000.Dialogue: Get over yourself. It's a high-tech toilet.

00:00:37:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:37:110000.Dialogue: Just think. Thanks to your hard work, an international crew of astronauts

00:00:41:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:00:41:020000.Dialogue: will boldly go where no man has gone before.

00:00:45:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:45:090000.Dialogue: - Is that supposed to be funny?

00:00:56:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:00:56:220000.Dialogue: Okay, make your little jokes, but of the four of us, I'm the only one making any real-world contribution to science and technology.

00:01:04:100000.Speaker: Raj
00:01:04:100000.Dialogue: He's right. This is an important achievement, for two reasons. Number one... and, of course, number two!

00:01:13:000000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:13:000000.Dialogue: Clever! Playing on the use of cardinal numbers as euphemisms for bodily functions.

00:01:23:010000.Speaker: Stuart
00:01:23:010000.Dialogue: Here, Sheldon, I pulled the new Hellboy for you. It's mind-blowing.

00:01:32:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:32:190000.Dialogue: You told me it's mind-blowing. So, my mind is going into it pre-blown.

00:01:37:030000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:01:37:030000.Dialogue: And once a mind is pre-blown, it cannot be re-blown.

00:01:48:030000.Speaker: Stuart
00:01:48:030000.Dialogue: - Can I talk to you about something?

00:01:50:100000.Speaker: Stuart
00:01:50:100000.Dialogue: Remember I went out with Penny, a couple weeks ago?

00:02:05:130000.Speaker: Stuart
00:02:05:130000.Dialogue: The thing is, the date didn't go that well.

00:02:11:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:11:090000.Dialogue: I guess the thing to do now is just pick yourself up, dust yourself off, forget it and move on.

00:02:22:010000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:22:010000.Dialogue: Excuse me, Stuart. Have you read the new Flash? Well, I have and it will knock your socks off!

00:02:29:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:02:29:190000.Dialogue: Good luck getting them back on.

00:02:35:030000.Speaker: Stuart
00:02:35:030000.Dialogue: This is probably my last shot with Penny and I don't want to screw it up.

00:02:41:040000.Speaker: Stuart
00:02:41:040000.Dialogue: So, here's my question: It's the second date, you think she'll be expecting things to get physical?

00:02:56:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:02:56:210000.Dialogue: but let me think about it and get back to you.

00:02:59:080000.Speaker: Stuart
00:02:59:080000.Dialogue: So, you'll give me a call?

00:03:07:040000.Speaker: Raj
00:03:07:040000.Dialogue: Interesting. Penny's current suitor asking advice from her former suitor.

00:03:11:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:03:11:220000.Dialogue: You know, thanks for closed-captioning my pain, Raj.

00:03:15:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:15:120000.Dialogue: Hey, wanna make sure he gets nowhere with Penny without jeopardizing your friendship with either of them?

00:03:22:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:03:22:070000.Dialogue: Just tell him to do everything you've done with her for the last two years.

00:04:01:030000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:01:030000.Dialogue: Fine. Can I ask you something?

00:04:10:100000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:10:100000.Dialogue: He asked me out again and I said yes, and then I started thinking maybe I should talk to you first.

00:04:16:190000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:16:190000.Dialogue: Does it bother you, me going out with one of your friends? 'Cause you know, you and me...

00:04:24:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:24:070000.Dialogue: I'm really more of a right now kind of guy. You know, living in the moment. Although I do have to live a little in the future, 'cause that's my job.

00:04:33:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:33:100000.Dialogue: Of course, my fondness for classic science fiction does draw my attention backwards, but those stories often take place in the future.

00:04:43:010000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:43:010000.Dialogue: In conclusion, no, it doesn't bother me.

00:04:47:010000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:47:010000.Dialogue: Okay, well, that's really cool of you.

00:04:50:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:04:50:100000.Dialogue: I wouldn't say cool. I'd just say... That's Leonard!

00:04:55:150000.Speaker: Penny
00:04:55:150000.Dialogue: In that case, do you mind giving me some advice?

00:05:00:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:05:00:230000.Dialogue: He's very shy. How do I make him feel more comfortable around me?

00:05:04:170000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:04:170000.Dialogue: First of all, don't underestimate the value of discomfort.

00:05:10:120000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:10:120000.Dialogue: Stuart thrives under pressure. That's why he works in a comic book store.

00:05:22:200000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:05:22:200000.Speaker: Leonard

00:05:27:130000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:05:27:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:27:130000.Dialogue: You're not going to answer it?

00:05:30:160000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:05:30:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:05:30:160000.Dialogue: He wants to talk about Penny. I don't want to talk about Penny.

00:05:34:100000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:05:34:100000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:05:37:070000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:05:37:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:37:070000.Dialogue: Perhaps the comic book store is on fire.

00:05:40:170000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:05:40:170000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:05:42:190000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:05:42:190000.Speaker: Leonard

00:05:45:050000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:05:45:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:05:47:070000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:05:47:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:05:47:070000.Dialogue: And if you don't answer the phone, we can't know.

00:05:51:200000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:05:51:200000.Speaker: Leonard

00:05:58:060000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:05:58:060000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:06:03:030000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:06:03:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:03:030000.Dialogue: There, it went to voice mail.

00:06:11:080000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:06:11:080000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:11:080000.Dialogue: Aren't you going to check your messages?

00:06:16:190000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:06:16:190000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:16:190000.Dialogue: You have to check your messages! The living of a message is one half of a social contract which is completed by the checking of the message.

00:06:25:130000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:06:25:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:25:130000.Dialogue: If that contract breaks down, then all social contracts break down and we descend into anarchy.

00:06:32:160000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:06:32:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:06:32:160000.Dialogue: It must be hell inside your head.

00:06:37:150000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:06:37:150000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:06:40:190000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:06:40:190000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:40:190000.Dialogue: Guys, we have a code red.

00:06:42:110000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:06:42:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:06:42:110000.Dialogue: Code Red the hospital emergency alert, the computer worm, or the cherry-flavored soft drink from the makers of Mountain Dew?

00:06:49:100000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:06:49:100000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:49:100000.Dialogue: Look, I was going over the schematics on my zero-G toilet, and I made a teeny tiny mistake on the specifications for the diverter valve.

00:06:56:010000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:06:56:010000.Speaker: Leonard

00:06:57:130000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:06:57:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:06:57:130000.Dialogue: It's gonna fail after about ten flushes.

00:07:00:180000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:07:00:180000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:00:180000.Dialogue: - But the mission is for six months.

00:07:13:080000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:07:13:080000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:07:15:000000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:07:15:000000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:15:000000.Dialogue: Are you crazy? What am I gonna say? I screwed up your toilet and there's gonna be crap floating all over your nice shiny space station?

00:07:21:230000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:07:21:230000.Speaker: Leonard

00:07:23:070000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:07:23:070000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:23:070000.Dialogue: I'm gonna figure out how to fix it, then I'll tell them.

00:07:26:070000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:07:26:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:07:26:070000.Dialogue: So, what do you need us for?

00:07:27:190000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:07:27:190000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:27:190000.Dialogue: He can't figure out how to fix it.

00:07:30:160000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:07:30:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:30:160000.Dialogue: You said you were gonna be supportive.

00:07:32:150000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:07:32:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:07:32:150000.Dialogue: I'm trying, but you have to admit this is pretty damn funny.

00:07:37:140000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:07:37:140000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:07:37:140000.Dialogue: I agree. It's the juxtaposition of the high-tech nature of space exploration against the banality of a malfunctioning toilet that provides the comic fodder here.

00:07:50:050000.Scene: The university cafeteria. Leonard’s phone rings.
00:07:50:050000.Speaker: Sheldon

00:07:54:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:54:230000.Dialogue: All right, this is an exact duplicate

00:07:58:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:07:58:060000.Dialogue: of the Wolowitz Zero-Gravity Human Waste Disposal System as deployed on the International Space Station.

00:08:02:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:02:150000.Dialogue: Don't you mean the Wolowitz Zero-Gravity Human Waste Distribution System?

00:08:15:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:08:15:160000.Dialogue: Here's an approximation of the spare parts available on the Space Station. We gotta find a way, using nothing but this, to reinforce this so the waste material avoids the spinning turbine.

00:08:25:170000.Speaker: Raj
00:08:25:170000.Dialogue: You mean so it doesn't hit the fan?

00:08:32:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:08:32:120000.Dialogue: I have to say, I thought the toilet humor would get less funny with repetition. Apparently, there is no law of diminishing comedic returns with space poop.

00:08:51:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:08:51:220000.Dialogue: Yeah, it's a regular Manhattan Project.

00:08:56:230000.Speaker: Stuart
00:08:56:230000.Dialogue: Tonight's my date with Penny and since we haven't been able to connect by phone...

00:09:06:110000.Speaker: Stuart
00:09:06:110000.Dialogue: Anyway, I was just wondering if you had any last-minute advice.

00:09:10:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:10:210000.Dialogue: All right, well, off the top of my head, I think the most important thing with Penny is to go really slow. I mean, glacial.

00:09:22:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:22:160000.Dialogue: Guys come onto her all the time, so, you need to set yourself apart. Be a little shy, don't make too much eye contact.

00:09:32:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:32:210000.Dialogue: And, you know, treat her with, like, cool detachment and-and, you know, fear.

00:09:46:000000.Speaker: Stuart
00:09:46:000000.Dialogue: Well, that plays right into my wheelhouse.

00:09:49:180000.Speaker: Leonard
00:09:49:180000.Dialogue: Good, good. You kids have fun tonight.

00:09:52:130000.Speaker: Stuart
00:09:52:130000.Dialogue: Thanks, Leonard. What is that thing anyway?

00:09:56:220000.Speaker: Howard
00:09:56:220000.Dialogue: You don't know what this is? Good. Get out.

00:10:04:060000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:04:060000.Dialogue: Be afraid of Penny. Nice. Very crafty.

00:10:07:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:07:220000.Dialogue: It wasn't bad advice. It's just wasn't particularly helpful.

00:10:13:040000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:13:040000.Dialogue: For what it's worth, my mother says that when we deceive for personal gain, we make Jesus cry.

00:10:27:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:10:27:110000.Dialogue: All right, what if we use this two-inch PVC - to reinforce the center cross-support?

00:10:31:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:31:160000.Dialogue: - No good. It might work for the Japanese and the Americans, but have you seen the size of the Russians they got up there?

00:10:42:160000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:42:160000.Dialogue: This thing has to hold up against a hearty potato-based diet.

00:10:50:040000.Speaker: Howard
00:10:50:040000.Dialogue: Maybe if you were helping, you'd feel better about yourself.

00:10:53:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:10:53:200000.Dialogue: I deliberately tried to sabotage Stuart's date with Penny.

00:10:57:110000.Speaker: Raj
00:10:57:110000.Dialogue: Of course you feel terrible. You completely screwed up your karma.

00:11:01:020000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:01:020000.Dialogue: You don't really believe in that superstition, do you?

00:11:03:180000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:03:180000.Dialogue: It's not superstition. It's practically Newtonian. For every action, there's an equal and opposite reaction. Leonard pretends to be a friend and acts like a two-faced bitch.

00:11:15:150000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:15:150000.Dialogue: Therefore, he is reborn as a banana slug.

00:11:21:020000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:21:020000.Dialogue: It's actually a very elegant system. You know, what goes around comes around.

00:11:24:230000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:24:230000.Dialogue: Speaking of what goes around comes around...

00:11:28:160000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:28:160000.Dialogue: Okay, look. Instead of trying to reinforce this structure here, what if we just ran another line, bypass it entirely?

00:11:35:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:35:130000.Dialogue: It won't work. The diameter of the tubing is insufficient.

00:11:38:070000.Speaker: Raj
00:11:38:070000.Dialogue: What if we reposition the collection tank?

00:11:40:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:11:40:110000.Dialogue: It won't work. No way to mount it.

00:11:42:060000.Speaker: Howard
00:11:42:060000.Dialogue: Okay, here's an idea. What if I change my name and go live with my cousin and her husband, Avi, in Israel?

00:11:57:030000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard knocks, Penny answers in her dressing gown.
00:11:57:030000.Speaker: Penny

00:11:58:220000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard knocks, Penny answers in her dressing gown.
00:11:58:220000.Speaker: Leonard
00:11:58:220000.Dialogue: Nothing. We just pulled an all-nighter trying to fix a zero-gravity... pasta maker.

00:12:05:200000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard knocks, Penny answers in her dressing gown.
00:12:05:200000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:05:200000.Dialogue: I'm gonna make a coffee run. Do you want any?

00:12:07:190000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard knocks, Penny answers in her dressing gown.
00:12:07:190000.Speaker: Penny

00:12:09:080000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard knocks, Penny answers in her dressing gown.
00:12:09:080000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:09:080000.Dialogue: Great. So how'd it go with Stuart last night?

00:12:13:160000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard knocks, Penny answers in her dressing gown.
00:12:13:160000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:13:160000.Dialogue: I really don't want to talk about it.

00:12:15:160000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard knocks, Penny answers in her dressing gown.
00:12:15:160000.Speaker: Leonard
00:12:15:160000.Dialogue: Yeah. Right. Sure. The thing is, before you guys went out, I spoke to him and...

00:12:20:230000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard knocks, Penny answers in her dressing gown.
00:12:20:230000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:20:230000.Dialogue: I said I don't want to talk about it.

00:12:23:040000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard knocks, Penny answers in her dressing gown.
00:12:23:040000.Speaker: Leonard

00:12:24:120000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard knocks, Penny answers in her dressing gown.
00:12:24:120000.Speaker: Penny
00:12:24:120000.Dialogue: What goes on between me and Stuart is none of your business. So just leave it alone, okay?

00:12:33:200000.Scene: Outside Penny’s door. Leonard knocks, Penny answers in her dressing gown.
00:12:33:200000.Speaker: Raj
00:12:33:200000.Dialogue: If you want to clean up your karma, go get my freakin' latte.

00:12:45:150000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:45:150000.Dialogue: Hang on, I think I've got this. Help me see if we can wedge this little piece of PVC behind the support rod.

00:12:51:130000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:51:130000.Dialogue: You're overestimating the tensile strength of the substructure you're building.

00:12:55:130000.Speaker: Howard
00:12:55:130000.Dialogue: Sheldon, I know what I'm doing.

00:12:57:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:12:57:060000.Dialogue: If you knew what you were doing, there wouldn't be a space toilet where my coffee table should be.

00:13:03:050000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:03:050000.Dialogue: Howard, wait. Why don't you use this instead of the PVC to keep the transverse filter assembly in place?

00:13:09:080000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:09:080000.Dialogue: Because this is not a spare part from the space station. This is the thing from the pizza box that keeps the lid from touching the cheese.

00:13:16:220000.Speaker: Raj
00:13:16:220000.Dialogue: That what that's for? In India, the lid touches the cheese. Of course, we also have rampant poverty and periodic outbreaks of cholera, so a little cardboard in our cheese is no biggie.

00:13:30:120000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:30:120000.Dialogue: An excellent idea! I could certainly use a break.

00:13:38:170000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:13:38:170000.Dialogue: Why does Leonard get to go?

00:13:40:110000.Speaker: Leonard
00:13:40:110000.Dialogue: 'Cause he's upset over his situation with Penny and if I have to hear about it again, I'm going to kick him in his ovaries.

00:13:51:090000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:51:090000.Dialogue: All right, I think we've got a prototype ready to test. Hand me that Tupperware.

00:13:58:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:13:58:020000.Dialogue: Damn right it's heavy. It's my mother's meat loaf.

00:14:01:140000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:01:140000.Dialogue: It's been testing toilets for generations.

00:14:05:110000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:14:05:110000.Dialogue: I must say, I think a detailed letter to MIT describing your current circumstances might entitle you to a refund on your master's degree.

00:14:14:180000.Speaker: Howard
00:14:14:180000.Dialogue: Okay, simulated zero-gravity human waste disposal test with meat loaf analog in... three, two, one.

00:14:33:090000.Speaker: Raj
00:14:33:090000.Dialogue: What do you think the problem is?

00:14:45:020000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:45:020000.Dialogue: Hey, Stuart, I need to talk to you.

00:14:55:210000.Speaker: Leonard
00:14:55:210000.Dialogue: You're kidding. Never worked for me.

00:15:00:040000.Speaker: Stuart
00:15:00:040000.Dialogue: Last night at dinner, I did what you told me. I went really slow, I kept my distance, and two bottles of wine later, we were ma king out in my car.

00:15:08:140000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:08:140000.Dialogue: Wine? I didn't say to give her wine.

00:15:12:170000.Speaker: Stuart
00:15:12:170000.Dialogue: It doesn't matter, that's where it all went to hell.

00:15:15:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:15:070000.Dialogue: During the kissing? What did you do, sneeze in her mouth? I did that to a girl once.

00:15:21:220000.Speaker: Stuart
00:15:21:220000.Dialogue: No, everything was good and really hot. And I said, Oh, Penny, and right where she was supposed to say, Oh, Stuart, she said... your name.

00:15:44:030000.Speaker: Leonard
00:15:44:030000.Dialogue: I'm sorry. That must've been the last thing you wanted to hear.

00:15:48:210000.Speaker: Stuart
00:15:48:210000.Dialogue: It beats, You know I'm a dude, right?

00:16:03:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:03:100000.Dialogue: I'm sorry it didn't work out.

00:16:28:020000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:16:28:020000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:28:020000.Dialogue: Yes, sir, I understand classified. We'll keep it all classified; no one has to know but you and me.

00:16:33:170000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:16:33:170000.Speaker: Penny

00:16:35:070000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:16:35:070000.Speaker: Leonard
00:16:35:070000.Dialogue: Howard's space toilet. I'll tell you later.

00:16:39:120000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:16:39:120000.Speaker: Howard
00:16:39:120000.Dialogue: Well, they've deployed our solution. Let's just all hope it works.

00:16:44:070000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:16:44:070000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:44:070000.Dialogue: I don't see why I have to worry. My career's not hanging in the balance.

00:16:55:060000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:16:55:060000.Speaker: Sheldon
00:16:55:060000.Dialogue: That was a joke. It's funny, because it's true.

00:17:04:180000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:04:180000.Speaker: Penny
00:17:04:180000.Dialogue: Leonard, could you pass the soy sauce, please?

00:17:07:090000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:07:090000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:07:090000.Dialogue: I'm sorry, were you talking to me?

00:17:09:130000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:09:130000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:11:130000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:11:130000.Speaker: Leonard

00:17:20:100000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:20:100000.Speaker: Penny

00:17:22:160000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:22:160000.Speaker: Howard

00:17:25:100000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:25:100000.Speaker: Leonard
00:17:25:100000.Dialogue: What was it doing on the ceiling?

00:17:27:230000.Scene: The apartment. Howard is on the phone.
00:17:27:230000.Speaker: Howard

00:17:35:220000.Speaker: Voice
00:17:35:220000.Dialogue: Houston, International Space Station. We have a little situation up here.

00:17:41:080000.Speaker: Voice
00:17:41:080000.Dialogue: We'd like to make an unscheduled space walk.

00:17:45:150000.Speaker: Houston
00:17:45:150000.Dialogue: I.S.S., Houston. Which crew members would be involved in this E.V.A.?

00:17:49:130000.Speaker: ISS voice
00:17:49:130000.Dialogue: Houston, we'd all like to step outside for a few minutes.

00:17:54:210000.Speaker: Houston
00:17:54:210000.Dialogue: I.S.S., I'm afraid we can't authorize that.

00:17:58:190000.Speaker: ISS voice
00:17:58:190000.Dialogue: Houston, this is more of an FYI call. We are basically out the door.
